4631.verse-arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ ق ۚ وَالْقُرْآنِ الْمَجِيدِ

clauses-english.clause: Qaf.
By the honored Qur'an...

4632.verse-arabic: بَلْ عَجِبُوا أَن جَاءَهُم مُّنذِرٌ مِّنْهُمْ فَقَالَ الْكَافِرُونَ هَٰذَا شَيْءٌ عَجِيبٌ
4632.verse-english: But they wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves, and the disbelievers say, "This is an amazing thing.

clauses-english.clause: But they wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves,
and the disbelievers say,
"This is an amazing thing.

4633.verse-arabic: أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا ۖ ذَٰلِكَ رَجْعٌ بَعِيدٌ
4633.verse-english: When we have died and have become dust, [we will return to life]? That is a distant return."

clauses-english.clause: When we have died and have become dust,
[we will return to life]?
That is a distant return.

4634.verse-arabic: قَدْ عَلِمْنَا مَا تَنقُصُ الْأَرْضُ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَعِندَنَا كِتَابٌ حَفِيظٌ
4634.verse-english: We know what the earth diminishes of them, and with Us is a retaining record.

clauses-english.clause: We know what the earth diminishes of them,
and with Us is a retaining record.

4635.verse-arabic: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا بِالْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَاءَهُمْ فَهُمْ فِي أَمْرٍ مَّرِيجٍ
4635.verse-english: But they denied the truth when it came to them, so they are in a confused condition.

clauses-english.clause: But they denied the truth when it came to them,
so they are in a confused condition.

4636.verse-arabic: أَفَلَمْ يَنظُرُوا إِلَى السَّمَاءِ فَوْقَهُمْ كَيْفَ بَنَيْنَاهَا وَزَيَّنَّاهَا وَمَا لَهَا مِن فُرُوجٍ
4636.verse-english: Have they not looked at the heaven above them - how We structured it and adorned it and [how] it has no rifts?

clauses-english.clause: Have they not looked at the heaven above them -
how We structured it and adorned it and [how] it has no rifts?

4637.verse-arabic: وَالْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَاهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ وَأَنبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍ بَهِيجٍ
4637.verse-english: And the earth - We spread it out and cast therein firmly set mountains and made grow therein [something] of every beautiful kind,

clauses-english.clause: And the earth -
We spread it out and cast therein firmly set mountains and made grow therein [something] of every beautiful kind,

4638.verse-english: Giving insight and a reminder for every servant who turns [to Allah].

clauses-english.clause: Giving insight and a reminder for every servant who turns [to God].

4639.verse-arabic: وَنَزَّلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً مُّبَارَكًا فَأَنبَتْنَا بِهِ جَنَّاتٍ وَحَبَّ الْحَصِيدِ
4639.verse-english: And We have sent down blessed rain from the sky and made grow thereby gardens and grain from the harvest

clauses-arabic.clause: وَنَزَّلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً مُّبَارَكًا فَأَنبَتْنَا بِهِ جَنَّاتٍ وَحَبَّ الْحَصِيدِ

clauses-english.clause: And We have sent down blessed rain from the sky and made grow thereby gardens and grain from the harvest

4640.verse-english: And lofty palm trees having fruit arranged in layers -

clauses-english.clause: And lofty palm trees having fruit arranged in layers -

4641.verse-arabic: رِّزْقًا لِّلْعِبَادِ ۖ وَأَحْيَيْنَا بِهِ بَلْدَةً مَّيْتًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ الْخُرُوجُ
4641.verse-english: As provision for the servants, and We have given life thereby to a dead land. Thus is the resurrection.

clauses-english.clause: As provision for the servants,
and We have given life thereby to a dead land.
Thus is the resurrection.

4642.verse-arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَأَصْحَابُ الرَّسِّ وَثَمُودُ
4642.verse-english: The people of Noah denied before them, and the companions of the well and Thamud

clauses-english.clause: The people of Noah denied before them,
and the companions of the well and Thamud

4643.verse-english: And 'Aad and Pharaoh and the brothers of Lot

clauses-english.clause: And 'Aad and Pharaoh and the brothers of Lot

4644.verse-arabic: وَأَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ وَقَوْمُ تُبَّعٍ ۚ كُلٌّ كَذَّبَ الرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ وَعِيدِ
4644.verse-english: And the companions of the thicket and the people of Tubba'. All denied the messengers, so My threat was justly fulfilled.

clauses-english.clause: And the companions of the thicket and the people of Tubba'.
All denied the messengers,
so My threat was justly fulfilled.

4645.verse-arabic: أَفَعَيِينَا بِالْخَلْقِ الْأَوَّلِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِي لَبْسٍ مِّنْ خَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ
4645.verse-english: Did We fail in the first creation? But they are in confusion over a new creation.

clauses-english.clause: Did We fail in the first creation?
But they are in confusion over a new creation.

4646.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنسَانَ وَنَعْلَمُ مَا تُوَسْوِسُ بِهِ نَفْسُهُ ۖ وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنْ حَبْلِ الْوَرِيدِ
4646.verse-english: And We have already created man and know what his soul whispers to him, and We are closer to him than [his] jugular vein

clauses-english.clause: And We have already created man and know what his soul whispers to him,
and We are closer to him than [his] jugular vein

4647.verse-arabic: إِذْ يَتَلَقَّى الْمُتَلَقِّيَانِ عَنِ الْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ الشِّمَالِ قَعِيدٌ
4647.verse-english: When the two receivers receive, seated on the right and on the left.

clauses-english.clause: When the two receivers receive,
seated on the right and on the left.

4648.verse-arabic: مَّا يَلْفِظُ مِن قَوْلٍ إِلَّا لَدَيْهِ رَقِيبٌ عَتِيدٌ
4648.verse-english: Man does not utter any word except that with him is an observer prepared [to record].

clauses-arabic.clause: مَّا يَلْفِظُ مِن قَوْلٍ إِلَّا لَدَيْهِ رَقِيبٌ عَتِيدٌ

clauses-english.clause: Man does not utter any word except that with him is an observer prepared [to record].

4649.verse-arabic: وَجَاءَتْ سَكْرَةُ الْمَوْتِ بِالْحَقِّ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنتَ مِنْهُ تَحِيدُ
4649.verse-english: And the intoxication of death will bring the truth; that is what you were trying to avoid.

clauses-english.clause: And the intoxication of death will bring the truth;
that is what you were trying to avoid.

4650.verse-arabic: وَنُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْوَعِيدِ
4650.verse-english: And the Horn will be blown. That is the Day of [carrying out] the threat.

clauses-english.clause: And the Horn will be blown.
That is the Day of [carrying out] the threat.

4651.verse-arabic: وَجَاءَتْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَّعَهَا سَائِقٌ وَشَهِيدٌ
4651.verse-english: And every soul will come, with it a driver and a witness.

clauses-english.clause: And every soul will come,
with it a driver and a witness.

4652.verse-arabic: لَّقَدْ كُنتَ فِي غَفْلَةٍ مِّنْ هَٰذَا فَكَشَفْنَا عَنكَ غِطَاءَكَ فَبَصَرُكَ الْيَوْمَ حَدِيدٌ
4652.verse-english: [It will be said], "You were certainly in unmindfulness of this, and We have removed from you your cover, so your sight, this Day, is sharp."

clauses-english.clause: [It will be said],
"You were certainly in unmindfulness of this,
and We have removed from you your cover,
so your sight,
this Day,
is sharp.

4653.verse-arabic: وَقَالَ قَرِينُهُ هَٰذَا مَا لَدَيَّ عَتِيدٌ
4653.verse-english: And his companion, [the angel], will say, "This [record] is what is with me, prepared."

clauses-english.clause: And his companion,
[the angel],
will say,
"This [record] is what is with me,
prepared.

4654.verse-arabic: أَلْقِيَا فِي جَهَنَّمَ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ عَنِيدٍ
4654.verse-english: [Allah will say], "Throw into Hell every obstinate disbeliever,

clauses-english.clause: [God will say],
"Throw into Hell every obstinate disbeliever,

4655.verse-english: Preventer of good, aggressor, and doubter,

clauses-english.clause: Preventer of good,
aggressor,
and doubter,

4656.verse-arabic: الَّذِي جَعَلَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ فَأَلْقِيَاهُ فِي الْعَذَابِ الشَّدِيدِ
4656.verse-english: Who made [as equal] with Allah another deity; then throw him into the severe punishment."

clauses-english.clause: Who made [as equal] with God another deity;
then throw him into the severe punishment.

4657.verse-arabic: ۞ قَالَ قَرِينُهُ رَبَّنَا مَا أَطْغَيْتُهُ وَلَٰكِن كَانَ فِي ضَلَالٍ بَعِيدٍ
4657.verse-english: His [devil] companion will say, "Our Lord, I did not make him transgress, but he [himself] was in extreme error."

clauses-english.clause: His [devil] companion will say,
"Our Lord,
I did not make him transgress,
but he [himself] was in extreme error.

4658.verse-arabic: قَالَ لَا تَخْتَصِمُوا لَدَيَّ وَقَدْ قَدَّمْتُ إِلَيْكُم بِالْوَعِيدِ
4658.verse-english: [Allah] will say, "Do not dispute before Me, while I had already presented to you the warning.

clauses-english.clause: [God] will say,
"Do not dispute before Me,
while I had already presented to you the warning.

4659.verse-arabic: مَا يُبَدَّلُ الْقَوْلُ لَدَيَّ وَمَا أَنَا بِظَلَّامٍ لِّلْعَبِيدِ
4659.verse-english: The word will not be changed with Me, and never will I be unjust to the servants."

clauses-english.clause: The word will not be changed with Me,
and never will I be unjust to the servants.

4660.verse-arabic: يَوْمَ نَقُولُ لِجَهَنَّمَ هَلِ امْتَلَأْتِ وَتَقُولُ هَلْ مِن مَّزِيدٍ
4660.verse-english: On the Day We will say to Hell, "Have you been filled?" and it will say, "Are there some more,"

clauses-english.clause: On the Day We will say to Hell,
"Have you been filled?
" and it will say,
"Are there some more,

4661.verse-english: And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous, not far,

clauses-english.clause: And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous,
not far,

4662.verse-arabic: هَٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِكُلِّ أَوَّابٍ حَفِيظٍ
4662.verse-english: [It will be said], "This is what you were promised - for every returner [to Allah] and keeper [of His covenant]

clauses-english.clause: [It will be said],
"This is what you were promised -
for every returner [to God] and keeper [of His covenant]

4663.verse-arabic: مَّنْ خَشِيَ الرَّحْمَٰنَ بِالْغَيْبِ وَجَاءَ بِقَلْبٍ مُّنِيبٍ
4663.verse-english: Who feared the Most Merciful unseen and came with a heart returning [in repentance].

clauses-arabic.clause: مَّنْ خَشِيَ الرَّحْمَٰنَ بِالْغَيْبِ وَجَاءَ بِقَلْبٍ مُّنِيبٍ

clauses-english.clause: Who feared the Most Merciful unseen and came with a heart returning [in repentance].

4664.verse-english: Enter it in peace. This is the Day of Eternity."

clauses-english.clause: Enter it in peace.
This is the Day of Eternity.

4665.verse-arabic: لَهُم مَّا يَشَاءُونَ فِيهَا وَلَدَيْنَا مَزِيدٌ
4665.verse-english: They will have whatever they wish therein, and with Us is more.

clauses-english.clause: They will have whatever they wish therein,
and with Us is more.

4666.verse-arabic: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْنٍ هُمْ أَشَدُّ مِنْهُم بَطْشًا فَنَقَّبُوا فِي الْبِلَادِ هَلْ مِن مَّحِيصٍ
4666.verse-english: And how many a generation before them did We destroy who were greater than them in [striking] power and had explored throughout the lands. Is there any place of escape?

clauses-english.clause: And how many a generation before them did We destroy who were greater than them in [striking] power and had explored throughout the lands.
Is there any place of escape?

4667.verse-arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكْرَىٰ لِمَن كَانَ لَهُ قَلْبٌ أَوْ أَلْقَى السَّمْعَ وَهُوَ شَهِيدٌ
4667.verse-english: Indeed in that is a reminder for whoever has a heart or who listens while he is present [in mind].

clauses-arabic.clause: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكْرَىٰ لِمَن كَانَ لَهُ قَلْبٌ أَوْ أَلْقَى السَّمْعَ وَهُوَ شَهِيدٌ

clauses-english.clause: Indeed in that is a reminder for whoever has a heart or who listens while he is present [in mind].

4668.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ وَمَا مَسَّنَا مِن لُّغُوبٍ
4668.verse-english: And We did certainly create the heavens and earth and what is between them in six days, and there touched Us no weariness.

clauses-english.clause: And We did certainly create the heavens and earth and what is between them in six days,
and there touched Us no weariness.

4669.verse-arabic: فَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ الشَّمْسِ وَقَبْلَ الْغُرُوبِ
4669.verse-english: So be patient, [O Muhammad], over what they say and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting,

clauses-english.clause: So be patient,
[O Muhammad],
over what they say and exalt [God] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting,

4670.verse-english: And [in part] of the night exalt Him and after prostration.

clauses-english.clause: And [in part] of the night exalt Him and after prostration.

4671.verse-arabic: وَاسْتَمِعْ يَوْمَ يُنَادِ الْمُنَادِ مِن مَّكَانٍ قَرِيبٍ
4671.verse-english: And listen on the Day when the Caller will call out from a place that is near -

clauses-arabic.clause: وَاسْتَمِعْ يَوْمَ يُنَادِ الْمُنَادِ مِن مَّكَانٍ قَرِيبٍ

clauses-english.clause: And listen on the Day when the Caller will call out from a place that is near -

4672.verse-arabic: يَوْمَ يَسْمَعُونَ الصَّيْحَةَ بِالْحَقِّ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْخُرُوجِ
4672.verse-english: The Day they will hear the blast [of the Horn] in truth. That is the Day of Emergence [from the graves].

clauses-english.clause: The Day they will hear the blast [of the Horn] in truth.
That is the Day of Emergence [from the graves].

4673.verse-arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نُحْيِي وَنُمِيتُ وَإِلَيْنَا الْمَصِيرُ
4673.verse-english: Indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and to Us is the destination

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
it is We who give life and cause death,
and to Us is the destination

4674.verse-arabic: يَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ الْأَرْضُ عَنْهُمْ سِرَاعًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ حَشْرٌ عَلَيْنَا يَسِيرٌ
4674.verse-english: On the Day the earth breaks away from them [and they emerge] rapidly; that is a gathering easy for Us.

clauses-english.clause: On the Day the earth breaks away from them [and they emerge] rapidly;
that is a gathering easy for Us.

4675.verse-arabic: نَّحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ ۖ وَمَا أَنتَ عَلَيْهِم بِجَبَّارٍ ۖ فَذَكِّرْ بِالْقُرْآنِ مَن يَخَافُ وَعِيدِ
4675.verse-english: We are most knowing of what they say, and you are not over them a tyrant. But remind by the Qur'an whoever fears My threat.

clauses-english.clause: We are most knowing of what they say,
and you are not over them a tyrant.
But remind by the Qur'an whoever fears My threat.
